title: Ticket #4607: Always update node status file
description:
Right now, we have some code in dag.cpp (see Dag::DumpNodeStatus) that prints out:

"Node status file not updated because it is not yet outdated"

then skips the printing out the node file. However, there's a very important thing we miss by not writing out the update -- the last updated timestamp. Since querying the status of the DAGMan job in the condor_q is quite unreliable (schedds at scale... sigh), we'd be able to skip the query if DAGMan never skipped the node status file. We would look at the timestamp and, if it's more than N minutes old, then query the schedd for the DAGMan job status.

Why not trust that DAGMan always writes out the node status file?

  1. This assumes there are no future bugs in DAGMan in the hold / remove path.
  2. This assumes that no sneaky admin did a "kill -9" on condor_dagman.
  3. Belt and suspenders! It's the HTCondor way. More seriously - we need something that emulates a job lease in a distributed system like this.

It would be perfectly acceptable for this behavior to be a HTCondor config parameter.
remarks:
2014-Sep-25 10:39:36 by wenger:
Actually, now that I think about it, I'd rather add it to the node status file specification in the DAG file, as opposed to making it a new config param. So it would be something like this: 

  NODE_STATUS_FILE statusFileName [minimumUpdateTime] [ALWAYS_UPDATE]
